content.framework_context: Cultural Meaning represents a fundamental dimension of human knowledge that recognizes how shared understanding, values, and interpretations shape all other forms of knowledge. At Level 0, it acknowledges that knowledge cannot exist in isolation from human meaning-making systems and social contexts. It serves as one of the five core lenses through which all knowledge must be understood and transmitted.

key_concepts.name: Collective Consciousness
key_concepts.explanation: The shared mental life of a society that shapes how knowledge is interpreted and valued

key_concepts.name: Symbolic Systems
key_concepts.explanation: The frameworks of meaning through which cultures encode and transmit knowledge

key_concepts.name: Social Construction
key_concepts.explanation: How shared understanding emerges through interaction and agreement between people

key_concepts.name: Cultural Evolution
key_concepts.explanation: The way knowledge systems adapt and change across time and societies

key_concepts.name: Value Frameworks
key_concepts.explanation: The underlying beliefs and priorities that guide knowledge development

major_principles.name: Contextual Embedding
major_principles.description: All knowledge exists within and is shaped by cultural contexts

major_principles.name: Interpretive Plurality
major_principles.description: Knowledge takes on different meanings across cultural frameworks

major_principles.name: Transmission Dynamics
major_principles.description: Culture determines how knowledge is preserved and passed between generations

major_principles.name: Value Integration
major_principles.description: Cultural values guide what knowledge is pursued and how it is applied

major_principles.name: Meaning Generation
major_principles.description: Culture provides the frameworks through which raw information becomes meaningful knowledge

relationships.connection: Cultural frameworks shape how empirical observations are interpreted
Cultural contexts influence what theoretical models are developed
Cultural values guide how knowledge is implemented
Cultural perspectives affect how we think about knowledge itself

implications.knowledge_organization: Requires recognition of cultural context in all classification systems
implications.knowledge_validation: Must account for cultural frameworks in establishing truth claims
implications.knowledge_transmission: Emphasizes role of cultural systems in learning and teaching
implications.knowledge_development: Highlights how cultural evolution shapes knowledge growth
